start.text:
Your name is Joshua Mortin, and you are 36 years of age. You live in a world that
is much like Earth, but it is a land ripe with magic, however the odds of a person
being granted the ability to use magic is very small. You, unfortunately, have
not been born with the ability to use magic.

start1.text:
You will go about your life over the next month and will be faced with decisions.
You must choose the correct path each time, or be faced with brutal consequences.
If, however, you choose the best scenario, you will be able to use magic!
Can you make it to the end while having a low enough cost?

choices.text: I'm too weak and scared and petite for this...

start2-0.text:
You thought you had a choice?
Idiot.....

Day1-0.text:
You are a farmer who lives alone in the land of Minia.
It is closing in on the end of harvesting season, and you need to purchase food and firewood
with the money you make this season to survive the winter.

Day1-1.text:
The closest town is a day’s journey--round trip, and you
need to sell before the end of the week, or the Woodcutter’s stores will run out.
You have had a bountiful harvest, generating more than enough food to survive the winter.
In a spur of the moment action, you come up with the idea to chop your own firewood.

Day1-2.text:
You are impressed with your amazing intellect and have made
the journey to the town. You are now choosing between purchasing an axe to chop your own
firewood, or purchasing firewood for a higher cost from the Woodcutter.

Day1-3.text:
Your current inventory: 300 food, 500 Minian Dollars.
Both choices give you enough firewood to get through the winter.
After you make this decision the day is over, and you go home.
